Your digital passport is your digital self.
Secure, convenient identification.

At first, you'll be able to present your digital passport when logging into applications, and eventually you'll be able to use it when asked to present identification in an in-person context (as you would with a passport or driver's license).

How it works

Registrar & Sign-up

Choose a digital passport registrar and sign up.

Contact Information

Next, you fill out the information in your digital passport (only what you feel comfortable including).

Verify Identity

After that, you can verify your social media accounts, your website, and who you are in real life.

Security

When you sign up for a digital passport, your provider will give you a secret key. So long as you keep that key safe and prevent others from getting to it, your digital passport will be secure and nobody will be able to impersonate you or steal your data.

Don't worry though! Your provider will do the hard work of keeping your key safe so that you never have to worry about it. In fact, many providers will store your keys across your mobile and desktop devices so that even they can't get to your digital passport or tamper with the data. These providers are the most secure and trustworthy, so go with them if you can.

Differences from Traditional Identification

In contrast to traditional forms of identification, your digital passport is not issued by a central authority, and you do not submit your information to any government or corporation.

Instead, you put together your own digital passport (with the help of a service provider) and it is verified by a secure network of computers around the world that can't be hacked or taken down.

The Future

Digital passports are the future of personal security and privacy. In the future, you will not need your ID. In the future, you will not need your keys. Your digital passport will be the last identification you ever need.
